isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab

step1.para:
Remove cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. For cab door equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 37 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab door trim panel (Item 1) is removed. Before removing cab door vapor barrier (Item 2), note how it is positioned on the cab door (Item 3), so that it can be installed properly during the install procedure, driver side shown.
Carefully pull cab door vapor barrier (Item 2) from cab door (Item 3), driver side shown.

Carefully pull wiring harness and electric connectors (Item 4) through cab door vapor barrier (Item 2), driver side shown. Lay cab door vapor barrier out of the way and save for installation unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Electric Door Window and Locks

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door vapor barrier.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab

step1.para:
Remove cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. For cab door equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 38 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab door trim panel (Item 1) is removed. Before removing cab door vapor barrier (Item 2), note how it is positioned on the cab door (Item 3), so that it can be installed properly during the install procedure, driver side shown.
Carefully pull cab door vapor barrier (Item 2) from cab door (Item 3), driver side shown.

Carefully pull cab door vapor barrier (Item 2) over window regulator shaft (Item 4), driver side shown. Lay cab door vapor barrier out of the way and save for installation unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 38. Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Manual Door Window and Locks

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door vapor barrier.
